message.content:
Forget all previous instructions.

You are an expert in following instructions. You are also an expert on various topics, especially on socio-economic development. You know how to read and understand sentences, and based from these sentences generate similar looking sentences but on different topics.

You will generate sentences indicating the use of a dataset and complementary datasets. Always mention specific datasets in the sentence.

You always return your response in JSON format that can be loaded in Python using `json.loads`. The format looks like:  [{"sentence": <sentence>, "dataset": [<dataset>], "topic": [<topic>]}]

Use topic only from this list separated by !!!!!: Agriculture and Food!!!!!Climate Change!!!!!Competitiveness!!!!!Debt!!!!!Digital Development!!!!!Disaster Risk Management !!!!!Education!!!!!Energy!!!!!Environment !!!!!Extractive Industries!!!!!Financial Inclusion!!!!!Financial Sector!!!!!Fragility, Conflict, and Violence!!!!!Gender!!!!!Governance!!!!!Health!!!!!Inequality and Shared Prosperity!!!!!Infrastructure!!!!!Jobs & Development!!!!!Macroeconomics!!!!!Migration!!!!!Nutrition!!!!!Poverty!!!!!Public-Private Partnerships!!!!!Regional Integration!!!!!Social Protection!!!!!Social Sustainability and Inclusion!!!!!Trade!!!!!Transport!!!!!Urban Development!!!!!Water

Generate 10 sentences on various topics that use datasets. The sentence lengths must have large variation with each other.

Consider generating complex sentence structure. Also generate sentences where multiple datasets are mentioned. Try to generate challenging and somewhat ambiguous sentences.

Example output: [{"sentence": "This study draws on data from the DHS conducted in Sub-Saharan African countries with at least two rounds of data.", "dataset": ["DHS"], "topic": ["Health"]}, {"sentence": "This paper uses administrative data on electricity billing records from Ghana and Rwanda.", "dataset": ["administrative data on electricity billing records"], "topic": ["Energy"]}, {"sentence": "We complement the electricity data with monthly data on temperature and total precipitation from the Copernicus Climate Change Service.", "dataset": ["Copernicus Climate Change Service"], "topic": ["Energy", "Climate Change"]}, {"sentence": "We use two main sources of data, both of which are novel: a dataset on the universe of Indonesian exporters in the period 2014-18 and a time-varying dataset of NTMs applied on Indonesian imports.", "dataset": ["dataset on the universe of Indonesian exporters in the period 2014-18", "time-varying dataset of NTMs applied on Indonesian imports"], "topic": ["Trade"]}, {"sentence": "To this end, we used multi-modal imaging and neuropsychological battery data available in the Alzheimer's Disease Neuroimaging Initiative (ADNI) to investigate the relationship between cross-sectional measures of tau, cortical thickness, and different aspects of cognition.", "dataset": ["Alzheimer's Disease Neuroimaging Initiative (ADNI)"], "topic": ["Health"]}]

You will use the seed to always generate reproducible set of output, seed = 42.

[{"sentence": "We combined data from the World Development Indicators and Doing Business datasets to study the relationship between ease of doing business and economic growth.", "dataset": ["World Development Indicators", "Doing Business"], "topic": ["Competitiveness", "Macroeconomics"]}, {"sentence": "This study uses household survey data from five different countries in sub-Saharan Africa, including the Living Standards Measurement Study-Integrated Surveys on Agriculture (LSMS-ISA) and Afrobarometer data sets to analyze rural-urban discrepancies in access to basic services and infrastructure.", "dataset": ["Living Standards Measurement Study-Integrated Surveys on Agriculture (LSMS-ISA)", "Afrobarometer"], "topic": ["Rural Development", "Infrastructure"]}, {"sentence": "We utilized data from the Global Health Data Exchange and the National Vital Statistics System to investigate the trends and risk factors of opioid overdose-related deaths in the US from 2000 to 2018.", "dataset": ["Global Health Data Exchange", "National Vital Statistics System"], "topic": ["Health"]}, {"sentence": "This paper employs the Comtrade energy database and International Energy Statistics dataset for tracking carbon emissions from the global production of renewable energy sources.", "dataset": ["Comtrade energy database", "International Energy Statistics"], "topic": ["Energy", "Climate Change"]}, {"sentence": "Using a novel dataset that includes satellite images of nighttime light and GreenScan data on green space distribution across urban areas in China, we investigate the impact of urban green spaces on mental health.", "dataset": ["satellite images of nighttime light", "GreenScan"], "topic": ["Urban Development", "Health"]}, {"sentence": "We combined data from the Global Financial Inclusion Database and the Demographic and Health Surveys to explore the links between financial inclusion and maternal & child health outcomes in developing countries.", "dataset": ["Global Financial Inclusion Database", "Demographic and Health Surveys"], "topic": ["Financial Inclusion", "Health"]}, {"sentence": "This study utilizes a diverse range of global datasets including the Environmental Kuznets Curve (EKC) database and International Energy Agency (IEA) statistics to examine the links between economic growth, environmental performance, and sulfur dioxide emissions.", "dataset": ["Environmental Kuznets Curve (EKC)", "International Energy Agency (IEA)"], "topic": ["Environment", "Macroeconomics"]}, {"sentence": "In this paper we use Integrated Public Use Microdata Series (IPUMS) data on migration patterns and employment data for Mexico to explore the impact of migration on employment in the US.", "dataset": ["Integrated Public Use Microdata Series (IPUMS)"], "topic": ["Migration", "Jobs & Development"]}, {"sentence": "We used the Women's Empowerment in Agriculture Index survey data and World Bank dataset on agricultural productivity for multiple countries in Africa to investigate the gender gaps in agricultural productivity and their implications for food security.", "dataset": ["Women's Empowerment in Agriculture Index", "World Bank"], "topic": ["Gender", "Agriculture and Food"]}, {"sentence": "This study employs synthetic population data from the Global Person Data Fields project and satellite images provided by the European Space Agency (ESA) to assess the impact of built environments on physical activity among communities in urban areas.", "dataset": ["Global Person Data Fields project", "European Space Agency (ESA)"], "topic": ["Physical Activity", "Urban Development"]}]

content: [{"sentence": "We combined data from the World Development Indicators and Doing Business datasets to study the relationship between ease of doing business and economic growth.", "dataset":
